Prerequisites: ACG4111 & ACG4341 BOTH WITH A C OR BETTER & ACCOUNTING STUDENT CLASSIFICATION.
Course Description: INTRODUCTION TO THE BASIC CONCEPTS, PRINCIPLES AND ENVIRONMENT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDITING. THE COURSE WILL EMPHASIZE THE AUDIT DECISION-MAKING PROCESS, RESEARCHING AUDIT STANDARDS, AUDIT PLANNING, EVIDENCE EVALUATION, AUDIT REPORTS, ETHICS, AND LEGAL LIABILITY.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS COURSE IS TO INTRODUCE THE BASIC CONCEPTS UNDERLYING AN AUDIT OF
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COURSE WILL FOCUS ON:
1. THE DEMAND AND SUPPLY OF THE AUDIT AND ON UNDERSTANDING THE BASIC CONCEPTS THAT
UNDERLIE THE AUDIT PROCESS: RISK, MATERIALITY, AND EVIDENCE.
2. APPLYING THOSE CONCEPTS TO THE REVENUE PROCESS, COMPLETING THE AUDIT, AND AUDIT
REPORTING.
3. PROFESSIONAL CONDUCT AND LEGAL LIABILITY AND INTRODUCES OTHER ASSURANCE SERVICES.
Textbook(s):
AUDITING AND ASSURANCE SERVICES: A SYSTEMATIC APPROACH, MESSIER, W., GLOVER, S., AND
PRAWITT, D. LATEST EDITION (OR EQUIVALENT). PCAOB AUDITING STANDARDS AVAILABLE AT
WWW.PCAOB.ORG
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
